Hey @here Im not sure which channel to ask this so i'll ask it here. I have a question on EIP-1559 hoping someone can clarify it for me. Based on this blog: https://hackmd.io/@tvanepps/1559-wallets

How gas fees are determined for ETH2 is that if the previous block is more than 50% full, it will increase the gas fees by 12.5%, if less than 50% full, it will decrease gas fees by 12.5%, and is block is 50% full, gas fees remain same. Then there is an example of 100% and 0% where gas fees increase and decrease respectively.

So if block is 51% on every block, gas fees will just keep increasing by 12.5% continuously? This doesn't seem right, I think I am missing something here ðŸ˜…

author: pietjepuk
content: No, 51% means only a small increase, not 12.5%

author: docker01
content: oh, how is the percentage increase determined then? Is there a breakdown somewhere I can read on?

author: pietjepuk
content: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1559, see the if-elif-else near `# check if the base fee is correct`

author: pietjepuk
content: It's just linear, so 51% full would mean a 2% of 12.5% = 0.25% increase in base fee. Definitely check for yourself by plugging in some numbers though ðŸ™‚

author: pietjepuk
content: No, 2% is how far between 50 and 100% full a 51%-full block is
